import plotly.express as px
source.87667f50:
fig = px.box(df, x="Year Quarter", y="Salary", color="Gender")
fig.show()
source.ac4fbe4d:
fig = px.box(df, x="Year Quarter", y="Salary", color="Nationality")
fig.show()
source.814ea776:
fig = px.box(df, x="Year Quarter", y="Salary", color="Degree Level")
fig.show()
source.ae8e4f62:
dff = df.groupby(['Year Quarter', 'Gender']).mean().reset_index()
fig = px.line(dff, x="Year Quarter", y="Salary",color='Gender')
fig.show()
source.57e51e5d:
dff = df.groupby(['Year Quarter', 'Nationality']).mean().reset_index()
fig = px.line(dff, x="Year Quarter", y="Salary",color='Nationality')
fig.show()
source.2718af8c:
dff = df.groupby(['Year Quarter', 'Degree Level']).mean().reset_index()
fig = px.line(dff, x="Year Quarter", y="Salary",color='Degree Level')
fig.show()
source.93960f24:
dff = df.groupby(['Year Quarter', 'Gender', 'Nationality', 'Degree Level']).mean().reset_index()
dff['Level']  = dff['Degree Level']
fig = px.line(dff, x="Year Quarter", y="Salary",color='Gender', facet_row='Nationality', facet_col='Level' , facet_col_spacing = 0.04,
             category_orders = {'Level': ['Primary' ,'Secondary' , 'Intermediate' , 'Diploma' ,'Bachelor', 'Master Degree', 'Doctorate'],
                                               'Nationality': ['Saudi', 'NonSaudi'],
                                               'Gender': ['Male', 'Female']})
fig.show()
source.15aa9dde:
# Conclusion: 
* Saudi have better sallary than non-Saudi regardless the level of education and gender
* Male have better sallary than Female regardless the level of education and nationality 
* Sallary increases with advancement of education
# Future analysis plan:
* Linear regression model; Y= Sallary, Xs = Year, Gender, Nationality and level of education
* Trend analysis using Joinpoint regression 
# Limitations
* We are missing important variables e,g, age and city, these factors might have an effect on gender inequality
